page.title: 09Haslington's Environment.
page.content: Although the area lies along a busy main road the effects of work connected with the road are minimal and much of the landscape remains unchanged .Similarly the new housing developments attempt to merge with the character of the area. The natural rural environment remains unchanged by development and the farming community farm the land with conservation in mind. There are many areas of woodland and major replanting is going on notably in the woodland area of Park Farm. Wildlife is rich. There appears to be a lot of rabbits this year causing damage to barley crops. The area is a "flat" area devoted mainly to dairy farming and crop growing so the landscape is shaped by these activities.
